idioms.meaning: the pen is mightier than the sword

idioms.reading: あくみょうはむめいにまさる
idioms.meaning: it is better to be infamous than unknown

lessons.japanese: 君は彼女に、勝るとも劣らずかわいい。
lessons.english: You are not less pretty than her.
The pen is mightier than the sword.

lessons.japanese: いかに粗末であろうとも我が家に勝る所はない。
lessons.english: Be it ever so humble, there's no place like home.

lessons.japanese: どんなに粗末なものでも、我が家に勝るものはない。
lessons.english: No matter how humble it is, there's no place like home.

lessons.japanese: 健康が富に勝るということは言うまでもない。
lessons.english: It goes without saying that health is above wealth.

lessons.japanese: 健康が富に勝ることは言うまでもない。
lessons.english: It goes without saying that health is above wealth.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は兄に勝るとも劣らぬくらい英語が上手だ。
lessons.english: She is good at speaking English, no less so than her brother.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は英語を話すのが得意で、兄に勝るとも劣らぬくらいだ。
lessons.english: She is good at speaking English, no less so than her brother.

lessons.japanese: よき言葉より、よき行いの方が勝る。
lessons.english: Well done is better than well said.
The pen is mightier than the sword.

lessons.japanese: 疲れを感じてるときは、入浴に勝る物はない。
lessons.english: When you feel tired, there is nothing like having a bath.

lessons.japanese: 彼女にとって息子の成長は何にも勝る喜びだった。
lessons.english: Nothing gave her greater pleasure than to watch her son growing up.

lessons.japanese: 彼は父に勝るとも劣らず利口だ。
lessons.english: He is not less clever than his father.

lessons.japanese: 二人の頭脳は一人の頭脳に勝る。
lessons.english: Two heads are better than one.
